strings.Value: "Get what for you?"
"Tell me what you want from me."
"I'll get you the First Crown."
"What's the First Crown?"
"Where can I find it?"
"What's in it for me?"
"Why do you want it?"
"I'll do it."
"I've got more important things to do."
"Enough about that for now."
"Who are you?"
"Why does your face shift like that?"
"What does an Eldest want with me?"
"Does Nyrissa know you're here?"
"A pleasure to meet you."
"Who are those two?"
"Who are the Knurly Witch and the Wriggling Man again?"
"Why do they hate each other?"
"What's the First Crown?"
"Did you say he's made of worms?!"
"I see."
[Attack] "Here's what I've got for you!"
"I think we're done here."
"This isn't the first time we meet, but I'm still curious — who are you?"

{n}The figure before you wears gray robes, yet the body beneath them flickers, changing age, gender, and race—one moment an ancient elven man, the next a young human woman, then a tattooed dwarf, and so on. They raise an eyebrow.{/n} "Well? Did you get it for us?"
"Well? Did you get it for us?"

"...oh, that's right. You don't know about that yet, do you? Honestly, we don't know how you people can handle only moving one way through time. But that's beside the point. We need you to retrieve the First Crown for us."
"Excellent. We'll be here when you return."
{n}{g|Shyka}Shyka{/g} shrugs.{/n} "'Now' is a matter of perspective."

"A magical bauble—the enchanted crown of the first king whose kingdom Nyrissa destroyed. She gave it to the Knurly Witch as a token of her regard, but now that the Wriggling Man is the nymph's current favorite, he feels it rightfully belongs to him. They've been fighting over it for weeks."

"In the course of their fighting, the Knurly Witch and Wriggling Man accidentally broke the crown into three pieces, the magical backlash teleporting each piece somewhere within this forest. If we knew exactly where, we wouldn't need you to search for them, would we?"
"You're after the self-styled nymph queen, yes? While we won't punish her directly, Nyrissa's recent overreach annoys me. Bring us the crown, and we promise you an easier time overthrowing her."

"A good rule for surviving the {g|First World}First World{/g} is to never ask a fey lord 'why.' Honestly, most mortals are overjoyed to get a divine quest! Let's just say that the crown has the potential to make significant ripples in this timeline, and we'd like to guide them in a positive direction. We could get it ourselves, of course, but there are..."{n} {g|Shyka}Shyka{/g} waves vaguely. {/n}"...politics."

"My, you're the bold one, aren't you? Our form changes because there have been many {g|Shyka}Shykas{/g}, and will be many more. Long ago, we decided to live interspersed rather than sequentially, so that we could each experience all of eternity. It's far more interesting that way."
{n}{g|Shyka}Shyka{/g} gives you a dubious look.{/n} "Of course you do. After all, why listen to us? We've only seen all of your future timelines."

"Our name is {g|Shyka}Shyka{/g}, though some call us the Many. We are of the {g|Eldest}Eldest{/g} — the fey gods of the {g|First World}First World{/g}. We embody that which you think of as time, entropy, and reincarnation."
"We assure you, the pleasure is ours."

"What does every god want, child? Quick and obedient service, with a minimum of annoying questions. You mortals often leave something to be desired in that respect, but we hope you'll prove us wrong."
"No. And trust us when we say that you'll find it better for all involved if you keep it that way."

"The Knurly Witch and the Wriggling Man are Nyrissa's chief advisors. The witch is a priestess of the hag goddess, twisting plants to her whim. The Wriggling Man was a mortal wizard who sought undeath as a swarm of grave worms. They're Nyrissa's most powerful allies, and they absolutely despise each other. Recently they've been battling over the First Crown."
"You do? What a bold statement. We're the god of time, and even we don't see everything."

"A creature like Nyrissa has no true friends, but she rewards her allies well. Both the Knurly Witch and the Wriggling Man seek to be her right hand, ruling her so-called kingdom by her side. Neither of them are the sharing sort."
"It's amazing the lengths you mortals will go to avoid death. Honestly, the whole mortality business seems like a hassle—we're glad the {g|First World}First World{/g} doesn't bother."
"We'll meet again. Or rather, we already have."

{n}You suddenly find that you've lost all desire to fight. {g|Shyka}Shyka{/g} gives you a patronizing smile.{/n} "Nyrissa is one thing, but we really wouldn't advise going around attacking actual {g|Eldest}Eldest{/g}. It's bad for your health."
"Think on my words. We'll meet again. Or rather, we already have."
"Won't you even listen to what I have to say?"
"Our grand old friends, and their grand old habit of speaking in riddles!"
"Isn't it always the way... 'Go do this job for us while we just chill out here.' Fine, many-snoots! Been there, done that."
"More games of the gods and those who fancy themselves gods. So tiresome."

"What is there to be glad of? The creatures of the {g|First World}First World{/g} enjoy their delusions of immortality, but even they are powerless to change the world's final destination. One day, every path will finish, every thread will be cut, and every life will find its end!"
"That was fun! I was even hoping for an encore! Why can't it always be like that — our enemies fight each other, and we get to watch them and clap?"
